bwwExcerpt: One of the best things about Tracz's book and Iconis' lyrics is that while most of the characters seem one-dimensional at first, they are given more sides, some quite surprising, in the course of the musical's two acts. Every one of the play's characters, in fact - except, perhaps, for Mr. Reyes and the unhuman Squip - becomes more than what he or she initially seems to be. Maybe that's why this play seems to resonate so well with young audiences. The misfits triumph. Putting up a smooth, assure
